page.title: 06Welsh Gas
page.content: The supply of Natural Gas for the whole of North Wales travels through an underground pressure reducing system on the site. It arrives from the North Sea fields through a high pressure pipeline. It is distributed through the gas pipe system built when town gas was produced here. It is a base for servicing and repairs to the pipeline system and an office to deal with customer queries. Accounts are computerised, the mainframe being at Cardiff with keyboards and monitors at Wrexham. Service and repairs are speedily dealt with as the vans are in radio contact with this office. A growing service is the sale of Petroleum Liquified Gas (P.L.G.) which is stored there. The engineers have their own helicopter, based locally, for surveying the pipeline routes.
